Author: jl777c#5810

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: since there are only 16 outbound connections, if people didnt run connectivity nodes to create more outbound channels, it would indeed create some asymettric performance advantage, that is unclear how much of a notarization advantage it will be, but we can assume better performance could only help

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: so if this became an issue, then all NN to compete would be running several or many connectivity nodes

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: if you extrapolate things beyond just the first step, you will see that overall it helps the network

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: the temporary advantage for better connected nodes will force others to improve their connectivity

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: if everybody did this to every chain, we would get a lot better connected networks for all the chains, but this would be cost prohibitive

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: i still dont see any real problem here
